channel.title: Drama, Film & Theatre Portfolio
channel.generator: Webpage HTML Export plugin for Obsidian

item.title: September 2025
item.description: #MonthThis is the file in which all the events of September will be detailed, any of the dates that are highlighted and/or underlined can be clicked to go the file associated with that day.

item.title: October 2025
item.description: #MonthThis is the file in which all the events of October will be detailed, any of the dates that are highlighted and/or underlined can be clicked to go the file associated with that day.

item.title: Etherville
item.description: #Day

item.title: Improvisation on the 8th
item.description:
#DayImprovisation is engaging in an activity that is not preplanned or prepared. There is spontaneity and freedom in the approach, allowing the activity to develop naturally without constraints.I was able to be creative in my approach to my work in class, particularly in the bit of adding sentences of the internal monologue to our Still Scenes from the previous class.I learned that I know a lot more that I previously realised and that I am not as bad as I thought I was with coming up with dialogue.
I can try to retain everything I’ve learned and pay closer attention to the show that we’ll be attending on Into the Woods P1, next week.

item.title: Into the Woods P1
item.description:
#Day On Monday the 15th of September 2025, we saw a dress rehearsal of the Musical Into the Woods.
The reflection for this show can be found in the Into the Woods P2 file, or below if the embedding feature works.Into The Woods by James Lopine, in my opinion is a fantastic show and needs to be watched/attended. The production that we attended in Gorey Little Theatre is no exception to that, the amazing team of set designers, actors, costume designers, musicians and make-up artists did a brilliant job at bringing this show to life. And it could even be seen by a blind man, that an incredible amount of love, care, time and effort went into this production.Now we only saw the dress rehearsal of act 1 on the night but it was brilliant nonetheless. During the show the team made excellent use of all sorts of techniques: The use of lighting was well done, they were still testing it while we were watching it because it was the dress rehearsal but they definitely got it spot on. Most might not have caught it but there were a couple of little soliloquies sprinkled in throughout the show. The costume design was spectacular especially for the witch, her entire face and identity was obscured till the very last moment at the end when she transforms. The set design I think was one of the best I've ever seen if not the best I've seen, creating an amazing atmosphere. The singing was brilliant as well, I have quite a fondness for musicals so that aspect of the show really spoke to me, so much that the main song with the whole cast saying "Into The Woods, dun dun Into the Woods..." has been stuck in my mind ever since. I would absolutely love to see more musicals in the future as per my aforementioned fondness of them, but I understand if this isn't possible.

item.title: Into the Woods P2
item.description: #Day Into The Woods by James Lopine, in my opinion is a fantastic show and needs to be watched/attended. The production that we attended in Gorey Little Theatre is no exception to that, the amazing team of set designers, actors, costume designers, musicians and make-up artists did a brilliant job at bringing this show to life. And it could even be seen by a blind man, that an incredible amount of love, care, time and effort went into this production.Now we only saw the dress rehearsal of act 1 on the night but it was brilliant nonetheless. During the show the team made excellent use of all sorts of techniques: The use of lighting was well done, they were still testing it while we were watching it because it was the dress rehearsal but they definitely got it spot on. Most might not have caught it but there were a couple of little soliloquies sprinkled in throughout the show. The costume design was spectacular especially for the witch, her entire face and identity was obscured till the very last moment at the end when she transforms. The set design I think was one of the best I've ever seen if not the best I've seen, creating an amazing atmosphere. The singing was brilliant as well, I have quite a fondness for musicals so that aspect of the show really spoke to me, so much that the main song with the whole cast saying "Into The Woods, dun dun Into the Woods..." has been stuck in my mind ever since. I would absolutely love to see more musicals in the future as per my aforementioned fondness of them, but I understand if this isn't possible.

item.title: Home
item.description:
Hello, welcome to the digital part of my Drama, Film & Theatre PortfolioWithin this site is my journey through this subject, in website form because I didn't like how inexpressive Google Docs or Microsoft Word was, I wanted to show my passion and my love of creativity so I created this website, allowing me much more freedom.To explore the portfolio there is two options, you either Click from link to link to traverse through the pages, starting on the Calendar page. OR
Use the file explorer feature on the left hand side of the screen to see each individual page, though I'd recommend using the #Month pages to see the entries in an organised form. P.S. Please ignore the sync and index files, I don't know why they're there, I deleted them but they won't go away.

item.title: Calendar
item.description: Within this file will be all of the months that I have spent studying the subject of Drama, Film and Theatre.It is not recommended to use the file explorer function at the side for viewing the days of each month, I'd instead recommend the visual calendar that is shown in each September 2025

item.title: Creative Groups
item.description: #DayI think the most crucial part of what makes a creative group work well together, is the desire & passion for the work. If no one is interested and passionate about working together and making a project come to life, they won’t be able to work well together. In addition to this I think it’s important for the members of the group to be of similar age/generation as this tends to have members being of the same culture and being able to connect easier. I also think in order for a creative project to be brought to life, the members need to have similar weight in the decision of what the work/project they’ll be doing will be.

item.title: Stage Plan & Monologue
item.description:
#Day
(The aforementioned stage plan can be found in my Physical Portfolio, or alternatively here)C1: “This idiot has no idea what’s coming to him. I’m gonna blow his stupid little head off. Why couldn’t he have just stuck to the plan, everything would’ve been fine, but noooo, he had to get greedy, well he knew what the boss said." C1, in a kind of high and mighty mock voice: 'He said 'Go in and bring back the boy and the girl unharmed' and yet here lies the boy, dead on the floor. And it’s not like we can just get rid of him now. Oh what am I do to now."

item.title: README
item.description: Hello welcome to the Drama, Film and Theatre portfolio of Name. I'm studying the subject in GCS from 2025 to 2027.
